comments:
Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1. In Java debug under 1.6, select in variable view to Show references

2. Select to open a reference
3. Often one or more exception are recorded in the error log
3. Sometimes restarting the debug session will help, sometimes not.



More information:
I have successfully used the reference view with variables being referenced from over 10k places. The case I am looking at should give me about 2k references.

Here is the error stacktrace:
org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException: Timeout occurred while waiting for packet 113164.
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply(PacketReceiveManager.java:171)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply(PacketReceiveManager.java:180)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:174)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:192)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.ObjectReferenceImpl.referringObjects(ObjectReferenceImpl.java:212)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIObjectValue.reloadReferringObjects(JDIObjectValue.java:405)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIObjectValue.getReferringObjects(JDIObjectValue.java:380)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIReferenceListValue.getReferences(JDIReferenceListValue.java:62)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIReferenceListValue.getVariables(JDIReferenceListValue.java:91)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.VariableContentProvider.getValueChildren(VariableContentProvider.java:166)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.VariableContentProvider.getAllChildren(VariableContentProvider.java:83)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.VariableContentProvider.getChildCount(VariableContentProvider.java:48)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.variables.JavaVariableContentProvider.getChildCount(JavaVariableContentProvider.java:59)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider.retrieveChildCount(ElementContentProvider.java:114)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider$2.run(ElementContentProvider.java:63)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
I am not able to reproduce. What kind of code are you working on? Can you reproduce with a simple test case (such as creating a large number of simple objects that all refer to a single object)?
I just had this happen in my workspace, can't reproduce consistently though.  Occurred with a relatively simple program after expanding a number of variables then collapsing and scrolling upwards.

I have been trying to reproduce w/o success right now. For over 1 day it was consistently happening and then all of a sudden it stopped. 

After that I even had a case where there were over 60k references and it was working. This seems to be related to the timing a certain threads or something.

If you see packets timing out,  there is a problem communicating with your VM.  On the Java > Debug Preference Page, there is a Debugger Timeout (ms) field.  You can increase this to give the packet managers the ability to wait longer for packet communication (including reference retrieval).

We can't do anything to prevent timeouts, but we are looking at what we can do to improve how the view reacts to them.

Created an attachment (id=74624)
Work in progress

Patch of current work to improve how exceptions during reference retrieval are handled.
